headline: The Score: Warner, Boeing, Dollar General, American Eagle and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Netflix  struck a $72 billion deal to buy Warner Bros., beating out Paramount and  Comcast  —and shocking Hollywood.  The acquisition would combine the largest global streaming service with the company behind HBO Max, the Superman and Harry Potter movies and hit TV shows such as “Friends.”  Warner plans to split its cable networks off into a separate company before the deal closes.

headline: The Netflix and Warner Bros. Deal Is Far From a Sure Thing
summary: Netflix  and  Warner Bros. Discovery  have reached a deal—but getting it approved won’t be so easy.  Netflix  on Friday announced that it has agreed to buy Warner Bros. studios and HBO Max once the company completes the previously planned spinoff of its global cable network operations.  The transaction is subject to regulatory approval.

headline: Paramount Considering Hostile Takeover Of Warner Bros.: Reports
summary: Late Thursday, Paramount Skydance (PSKY) attempted a final, last ditch, all-cash bid to acquire the entirety of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $30 a share, according to the CNBC. Warner Bros. rejected the offer, but Paramount may not be giving up. Warner Bros. accepted Netflix's slightly lower offer of $27.75 for only part of the entertainment giant. Paramount shares tumbled...

headline: Instant View: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises, including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry Potter", will further tilt the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.

headline: Netflix says its reached deal to buy Warner Bros.
summary: Netflix (NFLX) has won the dramatic bidding war for parts of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $27.75 per share. The total enterprise value of the deal is $82.7B. The deal is for Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service, HBO Max. The company will still spin out its TV networks, which includes TNT and CNN. Netflix came out on top -- beating out Paramount (PSKY) and Comcast (CMCSA). For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance. Editor's note: The headline on this post has been updated to reflect what Netflix is acquiring.

raw.headline: Netflix says its reached deal to buy Warner Bros.
raw.summary: Netflix (NFLX) has won the dramatic bidding war for parts of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $27.75 per share. The total enterprise value of the deal is $82.7B. The deal is for Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service, HBO Max. The company will still spin out its TV networks, which includes TNT and CNN. Netflix came out on top -- beating out Paramount (PSKY) and Comcast (CMCSA). For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance. headline: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game Of Thrones.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors for the bulk of WBD that also includes HBO, the HBO Max streaming platform and DC Studios.  While Netflix has agreed a $27.75 per share price with WBD, which equates to the $72bn purchase figure, the deal gives the assets a total value of $82.7bn.

raw.headline: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
raw.summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game Of Thrones.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors for the bulk of WBD that also includes HBO, the HBO Max streaming platform and DC Studios.  While Netflix has agreed a $27.75 per share price with WBD, which equates to the $72bn purchase figure, the deal gives the assets a total value of $82.7bn.

headline: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.
